result.execSummary:
The defendant Ernest Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ernest Williams is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ernest Williams was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ernest Williams in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defendant has been smoking marijuana.
Agent to test him for twice a month.  If positive, agent to contact the court.
CORRECTION: Plea entry of 7/13/2015 reflects corrected information as to count numbers.

Defendant Ernest Williams in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Victim notified for sentencing.
As to count 3:
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 35 days served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 1 year with the following conditions:
- Serve 30 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges; civil judgment if not paid.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at -0-.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Received and filed:
Justice Point report.
cab

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2 & 4
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state the court ordered counts 1, 2 & 4 Dismissed.
AS TO COUNT 3 AS AMENDED
Defendant changes plea(s) to NO CONTEST. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. Case adjourned to branch 36 for Sentencing.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.

Defendant Ernest Williams in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Jury Trial. Case RECALLED.  Parties have reached a resolution.
AS TO COUNT 3
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state the court ordered Count 3 Amended to REMOVE the Use of a Dangerous Weapon enhancer (939.63(1)(a).  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
CORRECTION: Information filed on 3/18/2015 included the enhancer of Use of A Dangerous Weapon (939.63(1)(a)). Charge amended to reflect change in CCAP.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Ernest Williams in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case heard off the record. Final Pretrial held. Parties ready to proceed to trial, neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Jury Trial at 8:30 am on 07/13/2015.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Ernest Williams in court with attorney Justin Singleton for Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Final Pretrial.  Defendant is out of custody, defense withdrew Speedy Trail Demand. Defense requests and adjournment of the Jury Trial date, state objects. Court GRANTED adjournment as a defense adjournment. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial and Jury Trial in branch 23. State's offer open until date of adjourned Final Pretrial Conference. Court VACATED Jury Trail date of 4/27/2015. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Jury trial scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

15RM016345  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03-27-15
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Ernest Williams in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Defendant Ernest Williams in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski for Ben Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Steven Pugely.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 23.  Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth in court, defendant Ernest Williams not in court, in custody.  Owen Piotrowski for Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant NOT produced from the House of Correction. Case adjourned with in 20 DAY time limit for Preliminary Hearing in branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact/NO FIREARMS Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TAMARA B.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Ernest Williams in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Ernest Williams in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge GRADY, Branch 23.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
